symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Calendar
symbols.description: Basic Calendar. This calendar is used for DatePickers

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: firstDayOfWeek
properties.description:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6. If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: months
properties.description:
Determines the number of months displayed.

As of version 1.50, the duplicated dates are not displayed if there are multiple months.

Note: On phones, only one month is displayed.

Since: 1.28.0.

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Note: Keep in mind that this property sets only weekly-recurring days as non-working. If you need specific dates or dates ranges, such as national holidays, use the specialDates aggregation to set them. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: showWeekNumbers
properties.description:
Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of Calendar

Note: There is a theme depending minimum width, so the calendar can not be set smaller.

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges for selected dates.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateRange class.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days in the Calendar. If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateRange class.

Note: Keep in mind that the NonWorking type is for marking specific dates or date ranges as non-working, where if you need a weekly-reccuring non-working days (weekend), you should use the nonWorkingDays property. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

aggregations.name: disabledDates
aggregations.description:
Dates or date ranges for disabled dates.

To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the sap.ui.unified.DateRange class.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Calendar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6. If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header
symbols.description:
renders a calendar header

The calendar header consists of 3 buttons where the text can be set and a previous and a next button. In the normal calendar the first button contains the displayed day, the second button the displayed month and the third button the displayed year.

Note: This is used inside the calendar. Not for standalone usage

properties.name: visibleButton1
properties.description:
If set, the second button will be displayed

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: enabledNext
properties.description: Enables the Next button

properties.name: ariaLabelButton0
properties.description:
aria-label of the first button (normally day)

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: ariaLabelButton2
properties.description: aria-label of the third button (normally year)

properties.name: additionalTextButton2
properties.description:
Additional text of the third button (normally year)

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: additionalTextButton1
properties.description:
Additional text of the second button (normally month)

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: ariaLabelButton1
properties.description: aria-label of the second button (normally month)

properties.name: additionalTextButton0
properties.description:
Additional text of the first button (normally day)

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: enabledPrevious
properties.description: Enables the previous button

properties.name: textButton0
properties.description:
Text of the first button (normally day)

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: textButton1
properties.description: Text of the second button (normally month)

properties.name: textButton2
properties.description: Text of the third button (normally year)

properties.name: visibleButton0
properties.description:
If set, the first button will be displayed

Note: The default is set to false to be compatible to older versions

Since: 1.32.0.

properties.name: visibleButton2
properties.description:
If set, the third button will be displayed

Since: 1.32.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month
symbols.description: renders a month with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set).

properties.name: firstDayOfWeek
properties.description:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6. If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Since: 1.28.9.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: secondaryCalendarType
properties.description:
If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the month name is shown

properties.name: showWeekNumbers
properties.description:
Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed.

Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of Month

Since: 1.38.0.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
DateRange with type to visualize special days in the Calendar.

Note: If one day is assigned to more than one DateTypeRange, only the first one will be used. The only exception is when one of the types is NonWorking, then you can have both NonWorking and the other type. For example, you can have NonWorking + Type01 but you can't have Type01 + Type02.

aggregations.name: disabledDates
aggregations.description: Date Ranges for disabled dates

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new calendar/Month.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: date

symbols.description: renders a MonthPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage

number of months in each row The value must be between 0 and 12 (0 means just to have all months in one row, independent of the number)

properties.description:
number of displayed months The value must be between 1 and 12

If set, the calendar type is used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

Since: 1.34.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthPicker

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow
symbols.description:
Renders a row of months using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarMonthInterval. If used inside the CalendarMonthInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The MontsRow works with JavaScript Date objects, but only the month and the year are used to display and interact. As representation for a month, the 1st of the month will always be returned in the API.

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + months in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: months
properties.description: Number of months displayed

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the years is shown to visualize what month belongs to what year.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single month or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as JavaScript Date object, of the row. The month of this date is the first month of the displayed row.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new MonthsRow. It shows a calendar with month granularity

Note: This is used inside the CalendarMonthInterval, not for standalone usage.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

returnValue.description: Value of property startDate

Start date, as JavaScript Date object, of the row. The month of this date is the first month of the displayed row.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow
symbols.description:
Renders a row of time items using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarTimeInterval. If used inside the CalendarTimeInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The TimesRow works with JavaScript Date objects.

properties.name: date
properties.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + items in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

properties.name: intervalMinutes
properties.description:
Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes.

Note: the start of the interval calculation is always startDat at 00:00.

An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the DatesRow instead.

A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: items
properties.description: Number of time items displayed

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: If set, a header with the years is shown to visualize what month belongs to what year.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single month or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as JavaScript Date object, of the row.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special item in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new TimesRow. It shows a calendar with time granularity (normally hours)

Note: This is used inside the CalendarTimeInterval, not for standalone usage.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 60.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval
symbols.description:
Calendar with granularity of months displayed in one line.

Note: JavaScript Date objects are used to set and return the months, mark them as selected or as a special type. But the date part of the Date object is not used. If a Date object is returned the date will be set to the 1st of the corresponding month.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: months
properties.description:
Number of months displayed

Note: On phones, the maximum number of months displayed in the row is always 6.

properties.name: pickerPopup
properties.description:
If set, the yearPicker opens on a popup

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date of the Interval as JavaScript Date object. The month of this Date will be the first month in the displayed row.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the CalendarMonthInterval. The width of the single months depends on this width.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected dates of the CalendarMonthInterval.

If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the CalendarMonthInterval. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow
symbols.description: A calendar row with a header and appointments. The Appointments will be placed in the defined interval.

properties.name: nonWorkingHours
properties.description:
If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.)

Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

properties.name: appointmentsVisualization
properties.description:
Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment

Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme.

Since: 1.40.0.

properties.name: appointmentsReducedHeight
properties.description:
If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height.

Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the row

properties.name: showSubIntervals
properties.description:
If set, subintervals are shown.

If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown.

If the interval type is Day, hours are shown.

If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

properties.name: showEmptyIntervalHeaders
properties.description:
If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame.

If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned.

Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: nonWorkingDays
properties.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.)

If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

properties.name: intervals
properties.description: Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType

properties.name: intervalType
properties.description: Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.

properties.name: showIntervalHeaders
properties.description:
If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders.

If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

properties.name: checkResize
properties.description:
If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

properties.name: groupAppointmentsMode
properties.description:
Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed.

Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date, as JavaScript Date object, of the row. As default, the current date is used.

properties.name: updateCurrentTime
properties.description:
If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the row

aggregations.name: appointments
aggregations.description:
Appointments to be displayed in the row. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

aggregations.name: intervalHeaders
aggregations.description:
Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things.

Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description:
Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Note These labels are also assigned to the appointments.

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the Appointments.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

constructor.description:

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getAppointments
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation appointments.

Appointments to be displayed in the row. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

methods.name: getAppointmentsReducedHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property appointmentsReducedHeight

methods.description:
Gets current value of property appointmentsReducedHeight.

If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height.

Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getAppointmentsVisualization

returnValue.description: Value of property appointmentsVisualization

methods.description:
Gets current value of property appointmentsVisualization.

Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment

Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme.

Default value is Standard.

methods.name: getAriaLabelledBy
methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association ariaLabelledBy.

methods.name: getCheckResize

returnValue.description: Value of property checkResize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property checkResize.

If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getFocusedAppointment

returnValue.description: Focused Appointment

methods.description:
Returns the focused CalendarAppointment of the CalendarRow.

The focus must not really be on the CalendarAppointment, it have just to be the one that has the focus when the CalendarRow was focused last time.

methods.name: getGroupAppointmentsMode

returnValue.description: Value of property groupAppointmentsMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property groupAppointmentsMode.

Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed.

Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

Default value is Collapsed.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

Height of the row

methods.name: getIntervalHeaders
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation intervalHeaders.

Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things.

Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered.

The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed.

Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

methods.name: getIntervals

returnValue.description: Value of property intervals

methods.description:
Gets current value of property intervals.

Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType

Default value is 12.

methods.name: getIntervalType

returnValue.description: Value of property intervalType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property intervalType.

Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.

Default value is Hour.

methods.name: getLegend
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association legend, or null.

methods.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow.

methods.name: getNonWorkingDays

returnValue.description: Value of property nonWorkingDays

methods.description:
Gets current value of property nonWorkingDays.

If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.)

If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

methods.name: getNonWorkingHours

returnValue.description: Value of property nonWorkingHours

methods.description:
Gets current value of property nonWorkingHours.

If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.)

Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

methods.name: getShowEmptyIntervalHeaders

returnValue.description: Value of property showEmptyIntervalHeaders

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showEmptyIntervalHeaders.

If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame.

If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned.

Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowIntervalHeaders

returnValue.description: Value of property showIntervalHeaders

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showIntervalHeaders.

If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders.

If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowSubIntervals

returnValue.description: Value of property showSubIntervals

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showSubIntervals.

If set, subintervals are shown.

If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown.

If the interval type is Day, hours are shown.

If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getStartDate

returnValue.description: Value of property startDate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property startDate.

Start date, as JavaScript Date object, of the row. As default, the current date is used.

methods.name: getUpdateCurrentTime

returnValue.description: Value of property updateCurrentTime

methods.description:
Gets current value of property updateCurrentTime.

If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time.

If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

Default value is true.

Width of the row

methods.name: handleResize

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oEvent
parameters.description: The event object of the resize handler.

methods.description:
After a resize of the CalendarRow, some calculations for appointment sizes are needed.

For this, each CalendarRow can trigger the resize check for it's own DOM. But if multiple CalendarRows are used in one container (e.g. PlanningCalendar), it is better if the container triggers the resize check once and then calls this function of each CalendarRow.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.CalendarTimeInterval
symbols.description: Calendar with granularity of time items displayed in one line.

properties.name: intervalMinutes
properties.description:
Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes.

Note: the start of the interval calculation is always on the corresponding date at 00:00.

An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the CalendarDateInterval instead.

A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

properties.name: intervalSelection
properties.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

properties.name: items
properties.description:
Number of time items displayed. Default is 12.

Note: On phones, the maximum number of items displayed in the row is always 6.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description:
Maximum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: If the maxDate is set to be before the minDate, the minDate is set to the begin of the month of the maxDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description:
Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object.

Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

Since: 1.38.0.

properties.name: pickerPopup
properties.description:
If set, the day-, month- and yearPicker opens on a popup

Since: 1.34.0.

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

Note: Selection of multiple intervals is not supported in the current version.

properties.name: startDate
properties.description: Start date of the Interval as JavaScript Date object. The time interval corresponding to this Date and items and intervalMinutes will be the first time in the displayed row.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the CalendarTimeInterval. The width of the single months depends on this width.

aggregations.name: selectedDates
aggregations.description:
Date ranges for selected items of the CalendarTimeInterval.

If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used.

aggregations.name: specialDates
aggregations.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special items in the CalendarTimeInterval. If one interval is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: Hidden, for internal use only.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: legend
associations.description:
Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates.

Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.ColorPicker
symbols.description:
Enables the user to select a color. The color can be defined using HEX, RGB, or HSV values or a CSS color name.

Note: Keep in mind that this control needs either sap.m or sap.ui.commons library to be loaded in order to work as it depends on controls available in one or the other library.

properties.name: colorString
properties.description:
Determines the input parameter that can be a string of type HEX, RGB, HSV, or a CSS color name:

  • HEX - #FFFFFF
  • RGB - rgb(255,255,255)
  • HSV - hsv(360,100,100)
  • CSS - red
Note: The output parameter is an RGB string of the current color.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Determines the color mode of the ColorPicker.

Since: 1.48.0.

aggregations.description: Holds the control layout.

aggregations.description: Holds the control invisible texts.

Fired when the value is changed by user action.

Note: When the user action is mouse dragging, the change event fires on the mouseup event.

Since: 1.48.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Currency
symbols.description:
A text view which displays currency values and aligns them at the decimal point.

Overview

The currency control consists of an amount, which is formatted automatically according to the user’s locale (using delimiter symbols for the decimal point and thousand separators) and to the currency set for this specific number (number of decimal places).

The currency is expressed as a three-letter code.

Usage

When to use

  • To display amounts with different currencies in a vertical layout, such as in a table, list, or form, and it is important that the user is able to compare the amounts.

When not to use

  • To display amounts with the same currency in a table. Use the sap.m.ObjectNumber instead.
  • to display a number with a unit of measurement that is not a currency. Use the sap.m.ObjectNumber instead.
  • To display an amount in a structure other than a list, table, or form.

Responsive behavior

The control supports amounts smaller than 100 trillion, which still fit on a phone screen in portrait mode. For larger amounts, the unit of measurement wraps to the next line, which makes it difficult to compare the amounts.

properties.name: currency
properties.description:
Determines the displayed currency code (ISO 4217).

Note: If a * character is set instead of currency code, only the character itself will be rendered, ignoring the value property.

properties.name: maxPrecision
properties.description: Defines the space that is available for the precision of the various currencies.

properties.name: stringValue
properties.description:
Determines the currency value as a string.

String value is useful if you want to store really big values. If there are more than 21 digits before the decimal point or if the number starts with “0.” followed by more than five zeros, it is represented in exponential form. In these cases use the stringValue property to keep the number in decimal format.

Note: If set, it will take precedence over the value property.

Since: 1.54.

properties.name: useSymbol
properties.description: Displays the currency symbol instead of the ISO currency code.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.FileUploader
symbols.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

properties.name: sendXHR
properties.description: If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: iconOnly
properties.description:
If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconFirst
properties.description:
If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: buttonOnly
properties.description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

properties.name: additionalData
properties.description: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.

properties.name: buttonText
properties.description: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

properties.name: fileType
properties.description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

properties.name: maximumFilenameLength
properties.description:
The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

Since: 1.24.0.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Since: 1.26.0.

properties.name: maximumFileSize
properties.description: A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description:
Custom text for the value state message pop-up.

Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead.

Since: 1.52.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Style of the button. "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" is allowed.

properties.name: sameFilenameAllowed
properties.description: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Placeholder for the text field.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

properties.name: uploadOnChange
properties.description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

properties.name: uploadUrl
properties.description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

properties.name: useMultipart
properties.description: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the path for file upload.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.

Since: 1.24.0.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the displayed control width.

aggregations.name: parameters
aggregations.description: The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden inputfield.

aggregations.name: headerParameters
aggregations.description: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

aggregations.name: xhrSettings
aggregations.description: Settings for the XMLHttpRequest object. Note: This aggregation is only used when the sendXHR property is set to true.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FileUploader.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: New file path value.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files.

events.description: Event is fired when the value of the file path has been changed.

events.name: fileAllowed
events.description: Event is fired when the file is allowed for upload on client side.

events.name: filenameLengthExceed

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The filename, which is longer than specified by the value of the property maximumFilenameLength.

events.description:
Event is fired, if the filename of a chosen file is longer than the value specified with the maximumFilenameLength property.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.name: fileSizeExceed

parameters.name: fileSize

events.name: uploadAborted

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description: Http-Request-Headers. Required for receiving "header" is to set the property "sendXHR" to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired after the current upload has been aborted. This is event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.name: uploadComplete

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response message which comes from the server. On the server side this response has to be put within the "body" tags of the response document of the iFrame. It can consist of a return code and an optional message. This does not work in cross-domain scenarios.

parameters.name: readyStateXHR
parameters.description: ReadyState of the XHR request. Required for receiving a readyState is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the XHR request. Required for receiving a status is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: responseRaw
parameters.description: Http-Response which comes from the server. Required for receiving "responseRaw" is to set the property "sendXHR" to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Http-Response-Headers which come from the server. provided as a JSON-map, i.e. each header-field is reflected by a property in the header-object, with the property value reflecting the header-field's content. Required for receiving "header" is to set the property "sendXHR" to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description: Http-Request-Headers. Required for receiving "header" is to set the property "sendXHR" to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description: Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful). To see if the upload request was successful, check the 'state' parameter for a value 2xx. The uploads actual progress can be retrieved via the 'uploadProgress' Event. However this covers only the client side of the Upload process and does not give any success status from the server.

events.name: uploadProgress

parameters.name: lengthComputable
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the relative upload progress can be calculated out of loaded and total.

parameters.name: loaded
parameters.description: The number of bytes of the file which have been uploaded by to the time the event was fired.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: The total size of the file to be uploaded in byte.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of a file to be uploaded.

parameters.name: requestHeaders
parameters.description: Http-Request-Headers. Required for receiving "header" is to set the property "sendXHR" to true. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

events.description:
Event is fired after the upload has started and before the upload is completed and contains progress information related to the running upload. Depending on file size, band width and used browser the event is fired once or multiple times. This is event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

Since: 1.24.0.

events.description:
Event is fired before an upload is started.

Since: 1.30.0.

methods.name: getAdditionalData

returnValue.description: Value of property additionalData

methods.description:
Gets current value of property additionalData.

Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.

methods.name: getButtonOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property buttonOnly

methods.description:
Gets current value of property buttonOnly.

If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getButtonText

returnValue.description: Value of property buttonText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property buttonText.

The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enabled.

Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getFileType

returnValue.description: Value of property fileType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fileType.

The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

methods.name: getHeaderParameters
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation headerParameters.

The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description:
Gets current value of property icon.

Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getIconFirst

returnValue.description: Value of property iconFirst

methods.description:
Gets current value of property iconFirst.

If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getIconHovered

returnValue.description: Value of property iconHovered

methods.description:
Gets current value of property iconHovered.

Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getIconOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property iconOnly

methods.description:
Gets current value of property iconOnly.

If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getIconSelected

returnValue.description: Value of property iconSelected

methods.description:
Gets current value of property iconSelected.

Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getMaximumFilenameLength

returnValue.description: Value of property maximumFilenameLength

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maximumFilenameLength.

The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

methods.name: getMaximumFileSize

returnValue.description: Value of property maximumFileSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maximumFileSize.

A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

methods.name: sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.

methods.name: getMimeType

returnValue.description: Value of property mimeType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property mimeType.

The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

methods.name: getMultiple

returnValue.description: Value of property multiple

methods.description:
Gets current value of property multiple.

Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getName

returnValue.description: Value of property name

methods.description:
Gets current value of property name.

Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

methods.name: getParameters
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation parameters.

The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden inputfield.

methods.name: getPlaceholder

returnValue.description: Value of property placeholder

methods.description:
Gets current value of property placeholder.

Placeholder for the text field.

methods.name: getProcessedBlobsFromArray

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an array of Blobs which is used for the final uploading.

parameters.name: aBlobs
parameters.description: The initial Blobs which can be used to determine/calculate a new array of Blobs for further processing.

methods.description:
Allows to process Blobs before they get uploaded. This API can be used to create custom Blobs and upload these custom Blobs instead of the received/initials Blobs in the parameter aBlobs. One use case could be to create and upload zip archives based on the passed Blobs. The default implementation of this API should simply resolve with the received Blobs (parameter aBlobs).

This API is only supported in case sendXHR is true. This means only IE10+ is supported, while IE9 and below is not.

This is a default implementation of the interface sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs.

methods.name: getSameFilenameAllowed

returnValue.description: Value of property sameFilenameAllowed

methods.description:
Gets current value of property sameFilenameAllowed.

If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs
symbols.description:
Marker interface for controls that process instances of window.Blob, such as window.File. The implementation of this Interface should implement the following Interface methods:

  • getProcessedBlobsFromArray

methods.name: sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs.getProcessedBlobsFromArray

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an array of Blobs which is used for the final uploading.

parameters.name: aBlobs
parameters.description: The initial Blobs which can be used to determine a new array of Blobs for further processing.

methods.description: Allows to process Blobs before they get uploaded. This API can be used to create custom Blobs and upload these custom Blobs instead of the received/initials Blobs in the parameter aBlobs. One use case could be to create and upload zip archives based on the passed Blobs. The default implementation of this API should simply resolve with the received Blobs (parameter aBlobs).

symbols.title: interface sap.ui.unified.IProcessableBlobs

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Menu
symbols.description: A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user. These actions (items) can also be organized in submenus. Like other dialog-like controls, the menu is not rendered within the control hierarchy. Instead it can be opened at a specified position via a function call.

properties.name: ariaDescription
properties.description: Accessible label / description of the menu for assistive technologies like screenreaders.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.27.0. replaced by ariaLabelledBy association

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: When a menu is disabled none of its items can be selected by the user. The enabled property of an item (@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#getEnabled) has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled.

properties.name: maxVisibleItems
properties.description: The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description:
The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

Since: 1.25.0.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The available actions to be displayed as items of the menu.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Reference to accessible labels (ids of existing DOM elements or controls) for assistive technologies like screenreaders.

parameters.description: Id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

returnValue.description: Value of property ariaDescription

Accessible label / description of the menu for assistive technologies like screenreaders.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.27.0. replaced by ariaLabelledBy association

methods.name: getAriaLabelledBy
methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association ariaLabelledBy.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property enabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enabled.

When a menu is disabled none of its items can be selected by the user. The enabled property of an item (@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#getEnabled) has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation items.

The available actions to be displayed as items of the menu.

methods.name: getMaxVisibleItems

returnValue.description: Value of property maxVisibleItems

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxVisibleItems.

The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: sap.ui.unified.Menu.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.unified.Menu.

methods.name: getPageSize

returnValue.description: Value of property pageSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property pageSize.

The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

Default value is 5.

methods.name: indexOfItem

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The item whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase in the aggregation items. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a item into the aggregation items.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: bWithKeyboard
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the first item shall be highlighted when the menu is opened (keyboard case)

parameters.name: oOpenerRef
parameters.description: The element which will get the focus back again after the menu was closed

parameters.name: my
parameters.description: The reference docking location of the menu for positioning the menu on the screen

parameters.name: at
parameters.description: The 'of' element's reference docking location for positioning the menu on the screen

parameters.name: of
parameters.description: The menu is positioned relatively to this element based on the given dock locations

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset relative to the docking point, specified as a string with space-separated pixel values (e.g. "0 10" to move the popup 10 pixels to the right)

parameters.name: collision
parameters.description: The collision defines how the position of the menu should be adjusted in case it overflows the window in some direction

methods.description:
Opens the menu at the specified position.

The position of the menu is defined relative to an element in the visible DOM by specifying the docking location of the menu and of the related element.

See Popup#open for further details about popup positioning.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase
symbols.description: Abstract base class for menu item which provides common properties and events for all concrete item implementations.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: When an item is disabled the item can not be selected by the user. The enabled property of the item has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled (Menu#getEnabled).

properties.name: startsSection
properties.description: Defines whether a visual separator should be rendered before the item. Note: If an item is invisible also the separator of this item is not shown.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Invisible items do not appear in the menu.

aggregations.name: submenu
aggregations.description: An optional submenu of the item which is opened when the item is selected by the user.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Abstract base class MenuItemBase for menu item elements. Please use concrete subclasses.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: select

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The current item

events.description: Fired when the item is selected by the user. Note: The event is also available for items which have a submenu. In general, applications must not handle event in this case because the user selection opens the sub menu.

methods.name: attachSelect

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the select event of this sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase itself.

Fired when the item is selected by the user. Note: The event is also available for items which have a submenu. In general, applications must not handle event in this case because the user selection opens the sub menu.

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the select event of this sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.Shell
symbols.description: The shell control is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The application icon. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.

properties.name: searchVisible
properties.description:
If set to false, the search area (aggregation 'search') is hidden. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.

Since: 1.18.

properties.name: showCurtain
properties.description: Shows / Hides the curtain.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.16.3. Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.

properties.name: showCurtainPane
properties.description: Shows / Hides the side pane on the curtain.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.16.3. Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.

aggregations.name: curtainContent
aggregations.description: The content to appear in the curtain area.

aggregations.name: curtainPaneContent
aggregations.description: The content to appear in the pane area of the curtain.

aggregations.name: headItems
aggregations.description: The buttons shown in the begin (left in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

aggregations.name: headEndItems
aggregations.description: The buttons shown in the end (right in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported (when user is set only 1). If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

aggregations.name: search
aggregations.description: Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the shell header. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

aggregations.name: user
aggregations.description: The user item which is rendered in the shell header beside the items. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

The buttons shown in the end (right in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported (when user is set only 1). If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

The buttons shown in the begin (left in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem
symbols.description: Header Action item of the Shell.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon of the item, either defined in the sap.ui.core.IconPool or a URI to a custom image. An icon must be set.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the toggle state in case the item represents a toggle button (see also property toggleEnabled).

properties.name: showMarker
properties.description: If set to true, a theme dependent marker is shown on the item.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.18. Markers should not be used anymore.

properties.name: showSeparator
properties.description:
If set to true, a separator is displayed after the item.

Since: 1.22.5.

properties.name: startsSection
properties.description: If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.18. Dividers are not supported anymore.

properties.name: toggleEnabled
properties.description:
If set to true, the item represents a toggle button. The selected property can the be used to define the toggle state. Otherwise the item is displayed as action button. In this case the selected property is ignored.

Since: 1.34.3.

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
Invisible items are not shown on the UI.

Since: 1.18.

associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ShellHeadItem.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem itself.

Event is fired when the user presses the item.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.name: sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout
symbols.description: The shell layout is the base for the shell control which is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

properties.name: headerHiding
properties.description: Whether the header can be hidden (manually or automatically). This feature is only available when touch events are supported.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: If set to false, no header (and no items, search, ...) is shown.

properties.name: showPane
properties.description: Shows / Hides the side pane.

aggregations.description: The content to appear in the main canvas.

aggregations.description: The content to appear in the pane area.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: The control to appear in the header area.

aggregations.name: canvasSplitContainer
aggregations.description: Private storage for the internal split container for the canvas.

aggregations.name: curtainSplitContainer
aggregations.description: Private storage for the internal split container for the curtain.
